intro: Diodia subulata, commonly known as the slender diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Diodia subulata is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
